title: Restaurant Supervisor Job at Greystone Consulting Limited
content:
Greystone Consulting Limited - Our client, a fast growing restaurant looking at expanding their team is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Supervisor

Job Location: Ejigbo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Restaurant Supervisor to oversee daily operations and ensure exceptional customer service in our establishment. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing staff, maintaining quality standards, and ensuring a smooth and efficient workflow throughout the restaurant.
	Key responsibilities include supervising front-of-house operations, assisting with staff training and scheduling, handling customer inquiries and complaints, monitoring inventory, and supporting the management team in achieving operational goals.
	The Restaurant Supervisor plays a vital role in creating a welcoming dining experience and maintaining a positive and productive team environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate the activities of restaurant staff to ensure high-quality service.
	Support the hiring, training, and development of team members.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and hygiene standards.
	Handle customer concerns and provide effective resolutions.
	Monitor staff performance and provide feedback to improve efficiency and service.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree
	2 years of experience as a Restaurant Supervisor.
	Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask and work efficiently under pressure.
	Knowledge of restaurant operations, POS systems, and food safety regulations.
	High school diploma or equivalent; additional hospitality or management training is a plus.


Preferred Skills:


	Time Management
	Attention to Detail
	Knowledge of Food Safety & Hygiene


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates can send their CV to: Consultgreystone@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: IT Manager Job at African Natural Resources & Mines Limited
content:
African Natural Resources and Mines Limited (ANRML), established by African Industries Group, operates a fully integrated iron ore mining and processing plant in Gujeni village, Kagarko LGA, Kaduna state—the first of its kind in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Manager

Job Location: Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Network Design and Implementation:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Plan, configure, and deploy network systems, including routers, switches, and wireless access points.
	Design network layouts that meet organizational needs and scalability requirements.


Network Management:


	Monitor network performance and availability to ensure optimal operation and minimal downtime.
	Perform regular network maintenance, including hardware and software updates, to ensure reliability and security.


System Management:


	Manage and configure applications/infrastructure including AD domain management, user/group/account management, Group Policy Objects, DHCP, WSUS, DNS, and IIS.
	Harden laptops/desktops through deployment of AD policies.
	Technical knowledge of RAID configuration, NTFS permissions, software/service pack installation, Roles and Features wizards, etc.
	Manage and monitor Veeam backup and set backup policies.
	Manage McAfee Antivirus tools, especially McAfee ePO; update virus definitions/signatures, set policies, and manage DLP configuration.
	Manage patch deployment via WSUS and manual methods when necessary.
	Ensure overall security and health of infrastructure following established guidelines and best practices.
	Communicate with vendors and the purchasing team for IT material quotations as required.
	Stay updated on the latest threats and vulnerabilities by reviewing known and zero-day issues and fixes.


Troubleshooting and Support:


	Diagnose and resolve network issues including connectivity, performance, and security problems.
	Provide technical support and troubleshooting for network-related user issues.


Documentation and Reporting:


	Maintain detailed documentation of network configurations, changes, and procedures.
	Prepare and present reports on network performance, incidents, and improvements.


Collaboration and Coordination:


	Work closely with IT staff to ensure network solutions integrate smoothly with other IT systems and services.


Compliance and Best Practices:


	Ensure network operations comply with organizational policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Stay updated on the latest network technologies and best practices to continuously improve network performance and security.


Requirements


	Strong English communication skills.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience.
	Experience in the manufacturing industry.
	Proven hands-on end-user support experience, including troubleshooting and resolving network issues on-site.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: george.mathew@anrml.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Procurement Manager (Raw Materials) Job at Cormart Nigeria Limited
content:
Cormart Nigeria Limited is one of the leading chemical and food raw materials companies in Nigeria. Since its inception in 1980, it has been on the forefront of production, importation, stocking and distribution of chemicals and other raw materials. We provide premium products and services across the paint, confectionaries, cosmetics, pharmaceutical, food and beverage industries. With cutting edge and cost effective products and solutions, Cormart represents the business interests of top multinational companies who wish to do business in Nigeria. Cormart is committed to the continuous increase of local production and expansion of its products range.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Procurement Manager (Raw Materials)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Duties & Responsibilities
Sourcing and Purchasing:


	Execute assigned procurement activities in line with the company’s purchasing policies, operational requirements and in alignment with the head of department guidance and strategy.
	Source and compare suppliersindustrial chemical , food grade chemical , pharmaceutical Chemicals and food raw materialsin line with product specifications, safety requirements,operational needs.
	Obtain and evaluate quotations, perform supplier assessments, and recommend vendors based on price, quality, and delivery capabilities.
	Raise purchase orders and follow through with vendors to ensure timely and accurate delivery of goods.


Vendor and Supplier Engagement:


	Liaise with approved vendors and develop tactical relationships to support quality, delivery, and pricing expectations.
	Track and document vendor performance to support periodic evaluation and improvement initiatives.
	Assist in vendor negotiations as delegated by the Head of Procurement.


Inventory and Supply Coordination:


	Collaborate with the production team to ensure sufficient raw material availability without overstocking.
	Support the monitoring of procurement lead times and delivery schedules to prevent stockouts and delays.


Regulatory Compliance & Documentation:


	Ensure that all sourced food, pharmaceutical, industrial chemicals and Food raw materials comply with relevant regulatory, safety, and quality standards (e.g., NAFDAC, SON, HACCP)


Administrative Support and Documentation:


	Maintain accurate and organized procurement records including supplier contracts, specifications, safety data sheets (SDS), and purchase documentation.
	Maintain accurate records of supplier contracts, delivery notes, purchase orders, and other procurement documentation.
	Provide timely procurement status updates to the Head of Procurement and relevant stakeholders.


Market Research and Analysis:


	Monitor price trends, material availability, and supply market dynamics for industrial and food chemicals
	Escalate to relevant stakeholders, critical market changes or supply chain issues that may impact production or delivery schedules.


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor’s Degree (B.Sc.) in Chemistry or any related discipline.
	Experience: 5 - 7 years of relevant experience inindustrial chemical, Food grade chemical , pharmaceutical Chemicals , and food raw materials manufacturing or distribution environment.


Industry Knowledge:


	Understanding of chemical material specifications, handling, and storage protocols.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career.cormart@clicktgi.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
